title: Republicans in Congress Shift to Backing Ukraine, Matching Trump’s Reversal
summary: After years pressing to end U.S. aid to Ukraine, many Republicans have abandoned that position now that President Trump is supporting the country against Russian aggression.

title: Senate Advances Trump Clawback of Foreign Aid and Public Broadcast Funds
summary: The vote to take up legislation to rescind $9 billion in congressionally approved funds suggested that Republicans would bow to the president’s wishes in the simmering fight over spending powers.

title: Trump Releases About Half of the National Guard Troops in Los Angeles
summary: President Trump mobilized the troops on June 7 in the wake of chaotic protests. They have remained in Southern California several weeks after most of the demonstrations had ended.

title: For Some Republicans, Trump’s Shift on Epstein Is Just the Latest Breach
summary: Right-wing Republicans have also criticized the president’s stances on Iran and Ukraine, hinting at a broader fraying of his political coalition.

title: Senator Hawley Aims to Roll Back Medicaid Cuts He Voted for in Trump Policy Bill
summary: The Republican senator introduced a bill Tuesday that would block restrictions on key strategies that states rely on to finance Medicaid and double a rural hospital fund.

title: Mamdani Says He Will ‘Discourage’ the Term ‘Globalize the Intifada’
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee in the race for mayor of New York City, moved to distance himself from comments that sparked outrage during the primary.

title: Andrew Cuomo Test Drives a Warmer, Friendlier Version of Himself
summary: Mr. Cuomo, the former governor of New York, has vowed to run a more energetic campaign than he did in the mayoral primary, and aimed to demonstrate that on Tuesday.

title: Rising Inflation Underscores Risks in Trump’s New Tariff Threats
summary: New data showing price increases last month could foreshadow even higher costs if the president imposes steep tariffs on Aug. 1.

title: Jamie Dimon Backs Jerome Powell Over Trump in Fed Fight
summary: The C.E.O. of JPMorgan Chase, who has rarely taken on President Trump during his second term, wades into the argument over the Federal Reserve chair.

title: Canada’s Mark Carney Says There’s Little Hope of Avoiding U.S. Tariffs in Trade Deal
summary: After long insisting that Canada could avoid Trump tariffs through talks, Mark Carney now says that is unlikely for any nation.

title: Trump Administration Initiates Trade Investigation of Brazil
summary: The United States has begun investigating Brazil’s trade practices and “anti-corruption interference,” after the president’s criticisms of Brazil’s treatment of Jair Bolsonaro, a Trump ally.

title: 2025 Emmy Nominations: ‘Severance’ and ‘The Penguin’ Lead the Pack
summary: The nominees were announced Tuesday morning at the Television Academy’s Los Angeles headquarters.

title: Emmy Nominees 2025: See the Complete List
summary: The 77th Emmy Awards ceremony is planned for Sept. 14. See all the nominees below.

title: China Is Spending Billions to Become an A.I. Superpower
summary: Beijing is taking an industrial policy approach to help its A.I. companies close the gap with those in the United States.

title: Why the Subway Still Floods in New York After Billions in Renovations
summary: The century-old system is being hit with more powerful and frequent storms, and it will take a multiagency effort to fix it.

title: Storm Threat Moves South Toward Virginia
summary: Lingering showers were forecast for the New York City area, but heavy rain and threats of flash flooding were shifting south on Tuesday.

title: A Scion of Democratic Politics Defeats the Upstarts in an Arizona Primary
summary: Adelita Grijalva beat back charges of “legacy” and embraced the memory of her father, Raúl Grijalva, to win the Democratic primary for the House seat opened by his death.

title: Democrats Broach Potential Walkout to Block Texas Redistricting
summary: Hakeem Jeffries, the House Democratic leader, told Texas Democrats on a call on Tuesday that the moment required everyone to take extraordinary actions.

title: Columbia Expands Efforts to Fight Antisemitism as Trump Deal Seems Near
summary: The university plans to offer additional anti-discrimination training in partnership with Jewish organizations. Some other measures could prove controversial.

title: University Leaders Reject Republican Attacks on Campus Antisemitism
summary: Leaders from Georgetown, the City University of New York and the University of California, Berkeley, said they are working to protect Jewish students but also free speech on their campuses.

title: Club Drugs Strain Health System on Ibiza, Spain’s Party Island
summary: Drug-related calls from nightclubs are driving Ibiza’s ambulance services to collapse, health workers say. It’s the latest example of tensions in Europe over tourism.

title: Huckabee Calls Death of Palestinian-American in West Bank ‘Terrorism’
summary: Mike Huckabee, the U.S. ambassador to Israel, demanded “accountability for this criminal and terrorist act,” referring to the killing last week of Sayfollah Musallet in the occupied territories.

title: What to Know About the Fighting in Southern Syria
summary: Druse militiamen have been fighting with Bedouins in the Sweida Province, and Syrian government forces and the Israeli military are getting involved.

title: Andrea Gibson, a Poet of Love, Hope and Gender Identity, Dies at 49
summary: A master of spoken-word performance, Gibson insisted that poetry, especially when read aloud to an audience, was a political act.

title: Mamdani for Mayor (if You Want to Help the Republicans)
summary: Get ready for the G.O.P. to run against “Mamdani Democrats” for several election cycles to come.

title: I’m a Genocide Scholar. I Know It When I See It.
summary: A professor of Holocaust and genocide studies comes to a painful conclusion about Israel’s actions in Gaza.

title: Robin Kaye, ‘American Idol’ Music Supervisor, and Her Husband Found Dead in LA Home
summary: Robin Kaye was found shot to death inside her home in Los Angeles with her husband, Thomas Deluca, the police said. A 22-year-old was arrested in connection with the case.

title: Found: A Lost George Washington Battlefield
summary: As a young officer in the French and Indian War, Washington was involved in a devastating friendly fire incident. Military veterans are helping archaeologists excavate the location.

title: Cram Wildfire in Central Oregon Grows to Almost 30,000 Acres
summary: The Cram wildfire grew rapidly over the weekend, threatening small communities and ranch land.
